benjamin Shepherd Photo editor

Randy Ollie Sports EditorMay  

Sophomore Maya HowardWatts jumps to make the grab against Swarthmore College Saturday PERIOD In Oberlins first Ultimate Frisbee tournament in decades the Preying Manti faced teams from Haverford College Swarthmore College Xavier University Ohio Wesleyan University and Lehigh University PERIOD During the qualifying rounds on Saturday the squad went  PERIOD On Sunday the team didnt lose a game heading into the championship match against Haverford College PERIOD With the score tied at  on a universe point  a gamewinning point in an Ultimate game  and a nationals bid at stake it looked like the Mantis season might be wrapping up early PERIOD But doubledegree firstyear Abby Cheng had other ideas knocking the frisbee out of her opponents hand and making a diving grab to snatch the disc before it hit the ground PERIOD She landed in the end zone scoring the winning point for her squad and sending the Manti back to nationals for the first time since  PERIOD The play also known as a Callahan is extremely rare PERIOD Senior Manti player Joelle Sostheim described the play as one of the most exciting and shocking moments of my life. ultimate Frisbee nationals take place during Commencement weekend from May  meaning that none of the Mantis senior members will be able to make the trek to Raleigh NC due to familial and personal obligations PERIOD However with a crop of talented underclassmen the Mantis prospects look promising heading into the competition PERIOD
